main event: On 13 October 1958, near Kleinostheim, Germany, a civilian reported observing a bright, white, spherical object moving in the sky. The object was estimated to be somewhat smaller than a football, displayed no sound, and was observed to be electric white and brighter than shooting stars.
interesting points: The object was described as somewhat smaller than a football and showed no signs of sound while emitting a white light brighter than shooting stars.
The report mentions that it disappeared rapidly, leading the observer to compare it to a shining star, and suggested no apparent cause for the unusual phenomenon.
The witness and their cousin observed the object, and it was also witnessed by the night shift staff at the radar station.
The report indicates that the witness had never seen an object like this before, adding to the mysterious nature of the sighting.
The report includes handwritten drawings and sketches of the observed object and the surrounding landscape for reference.
sighted object: Bright, white, spherical object moving in the sky
witnesses: Civilian along with their cousin and radar station staff
